root: ^Ah, detective, hello! An absolute pleasure to be running into you during your esteemed investigation!

here: ^Why, I was admiring this fantastic imitation of a ballroom!
^Whoever designed this had an idea of what a ballroom looked like, but not the proper flooring materials.
^Perhaps that’s why this place is abandoned, no proper dance hall!
^You mean you aren’t aware of proper flooring for a ballroom?
^Why, allow me to impart my knowledge!
^You see, dear detective, ballrooms should have hardwood or stone flooring, but these floors are made of tile!
^Quite the difference between those, you see.

c-0: ^Of course! Perhaps it will be of great use in unraveling this mystery!
c-1: ^Uh, how is that relevant to the investigation, exactly?
^A ‘thank you’ is the proper response, but I can’t expect you to have proper manners, now can I?

found: ^Have you found anything for the investigation?
^My eyes are not suited for straining themselves to see clues and whatnot.
^I’m sure you’ll have far better luck than if I tried.
^Glasses are merely a tool to assist in closing that gap between normal and myself.
^They can never truly give me the ability to see things as if I had biologically sound vision.
^Oh, well… I’m glad you can sort of see?
^Sorry for being rude about your glasses.
^Thank you for the apology, although I knew the whole time it was a well-meaning question.
^I hope you find all the clues you need to solve this mystery!
